scope.narrative: The IATI data will cover all the activities of UNCDF

publication-timetable.narrative: An initial set of information will be published by October 2012 (more details on 2011 financial information). This first UNCDF IATI publication will serve as a trial for a more full presentation of 2012 data in May 2013

publication-frequency.narrative: UNCDF's annual year runs from January to December. At the end of the first quarter, the books offically close. UNCDF will publish the data 4 weeks after the offical closure of the books, meaning in April/ May of each year

publication-lifecycle.narrative: UNCDF's current ERP system set-up doesnâ€™t allow managing the pipeline identification stage of projects. Whether this is definitely envisaged in the future, it is impossible to display this information in the short term

data-quality.narrative: UNCDF is using statistical verification of its financial data. Each year in December, a sample of projects representing at least 50% of the expenditures, is identified for auditing. The auditing process is executed after closing of the books and finished by May. Data will hence be moved to status verified data in June

approach.narrative: UNCDF will first make a spreadsheet compiling all the IATI relevant information to facilitate the conversion.

activity-multilevel.narrative: UNCDF uses projects to report all of its activities. All details will be provided at project level.

segmentation.narrative: UNCDF is a small organization and has tyically one or two projects per country only (activities in 4 countries cover exenditures of 5 million USD). A file per country would be too granular, hence UNCDF will represent its data in one file.

user-interface.narrative: UNCDF definitely envisages the possibility to represent its data in a user friendly format. It has however limited resources available to develop such tool. The development of an interface will depend on the easiness of using interface software developed by or for other organizations (e.g. UNDP)

total-budget.notes: Forward planning documents are currently not made in a format that can easily be shared. It will be attempted to create these documents by the time UNCDF developes its next strategic plan (2014-2017)

reporting-org.notes: This will be UNCDF by default

title.notes: All project titles will be published in the original language only for the moment

description.notes: The activity title should be clear enough in principle
The activity title should be clear enough in principle

activity-status.notes: The default activity status will be Implementation

contact-info.notes: Project Manager; need to investigate how we can automate this data; data clean-up in Atlas needed to ensure the latest project manager is mentioned

participating-org.notes: Implementing partner; currently UNCDF by default, but UNCDF should ensure the right implementing partner is mentioned when there is NIM implementation
Accountable for the use of the resources is by default UNCDF

exclusions.narrative: Global and regional projects can currently not be disaggregated by country. They will be displayed as "global" or "regional"

recipient-country.notes: The deartment ID tells in which country projects are implemented. However for regional and global projects, UNCDF is not able to split expenditure information by country directly from the ERP system. This is a working point

exclusions.narrative: Global projects can currently not be disaggregated by country. They will be displayed as "global" or "regional"

recipient-region.notes: Countries can be linked to regions based on a tree

sector.notes: UNCDF will use its two practice areas as sectors, local development finance (public sector financial management) and inclusive finance (banking and financial services)

default-flow-type.notes: By default UNCDF's assistance is ODA

default-finance-type.notes: By default Grant; UNCDF also gives loans, but those are currently not reflected in the expenditure statements. When in the future loans are also included in the IATI statements., UNCDF will need to revisit the default finance type too

default-aid-type.notes: By default UNCDF's assistance is project-type interventions

budget.notes: UNCDF is currently not able to give accurate estimates regarding budgets and planned disbursements, only historical expenditures are accurate. However, the organization is working on this.

planned-disbursement.notes: UNCDF is currently not able to give accurate estimates regarding budgets and planned disbursements, only historical expenditures are accurate. However, the organization is working on this.

transaction.notes: In a first phase, UNCDF will focus on publishing exenditure data only
In a first phase, UNCDF will focus on publishing exenditure data only
In a first phase, UNCDF will focus on publishing exenditure data only

document-link.notes: UNCDF will add an individual link to all project documents in the IATI data. Currently UNCDF is performing a quality check to ensure that all links are correct and functional

result.notes: UNCDF currently has no standard way of reporting perfomance data linked to financial performance. The most suitable moment to develop this link seems to be when the next strategic plan (2014-2017 is developed). UNCDF will consider to publish this data from 2014 onwards.
